reviews.review_text: One of my all time favorite novels!  Favorite novel that I have read by Tracy Chevalier. Griet life alters dramatically  after meeting the painter, Vermeer!  Great movie too!  Highly recommend this book and to my surprise when I was in Italy, a street artist painted the pic below on the street!  Couldn't put the book down...great recommendation from a friend!

The Novel the Girl With The Pearl Earring Here why I like and dislike this. To start off with I give this book 4/5 stars because this book is good, but not great. There are only one thing  I would change and multiple things I wouldn't. For the ideas I would keep the same is the introduction of Great and her family. Another thing I would keep the same is Vermeer. One thing I would definitely change is Catharina's attitude.  To start off about what I wouldn't change is the intro of Griet and her family for many reasons, because When her father's kiln accident she had nothing to do but be a maid and earn money for her family because her father couldn't. I also like that she was cooking in the beginning because it showed Vermeer that she was the right choice. Talking about Vermeer I wouldn't change him for obvious and less obvious reasons. obviously, he was the painter and he drew this. But he also had a secret relationship with Griet. which brings me into Catharina and why I would take her out. She just has a crummy attitude and she held Vermeer back from draw great pieces of art in my opinion.  Well, that's my view on the book and why I liked it. Although I would change one thing, I wouldn't change it all
Very well written, sensitive, and allows the reader to feel and experience the strong emotions of the characters. Insight into the characters' minds provided
A story told to imagine how this painting came about.  It also told of the life and times of this age and how art was a part of the age.
Similar to Handmaids Tale. Very well written.
A very interesting read.  Thought the ending was just right!!!!
It moved quickly, very beautifully written, but I wasn't in love with it.  It's also a short read and did make me look up Vermeer paintings.

title: Girl with a Pearl Earring

summary:
Tracy Chevalier transports readers to a bygone time and place in this richly-imagined portrait of the young woman who inspired one of Vermeer's most celebrated paintings.

History and fiction merge seamlessly in this luminous novel about artistic vision and sensual awakening. Girl with a Pearl Earring tells the story of sixteen-year-old Griet, whose life is transformed by her brief encounter with genius . . . even as she herself is immortalized in canvas and oil.

"[Chevalier] creates a world reminiscent of a Vermeer interior: suspended in a particular moment, it transcends its time and place." The New Yorker
story_arc: The story gets better over time
